result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan R. Garske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay fine/costs/DNA & Drug abuse surcharge. $500 cash bond on file to be applied to any fines & costs. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Early discharge of probation if recommended by the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jordan R. Garske in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF289 and 14CV264.

11:05 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Atty Knaapen states he will be providing the Court with an Amended Information.
Defendant and his counsel waives reading of the Amended Information.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF289:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Counts 1, 2 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
14CF289:
Count 1 -
Withheld sentence 
Placed on Probation for 18 months
Pay fine of $100.00 plus costs
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Maintain full-time employment.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Early discharge of probation if recommended by the agent.
$500 cash bond on deposit to be applied to any fines/costs.
Pay DNA Surcharge/Drug Abuse Surcharge
1 day jail credit 

Count 2 -
Placed on Probation for 18 months concurrent to Count 1
Pay Court costs which include DNA Surcharge/Drug Abuse Surcharge

Count 3 -
Placed on Probation for 18 months concurrent to Count 1 & 2 
Pay Court costs which include DNA Surcharge/Drug Abuse Surcharge

14CV264:
Forfeit the amount of $979.00 to the State.
Plea hearing at 07-20-2015 11:00 am
Defendant Record Update
Status conference at 05-26-2015 10:30 am
Status conference on April 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Record Update
Status conference on February 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on December 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on November 10, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Pre-trial conference on October 6, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jordan R. Garske in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jordan R. Garske in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass Cousins with Intern Taylor Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jordan R. Garske in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he is eligible, but has not been appointed an attorney yet.  Matter rescheduled.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Clerk is Shelley P.  DA #14PT1462
1:36 p.m.  Court calls case. 
ADA  Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of THC and Possess w/ intent-THC (>200-1000g).
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a cash bond of $1000.00  with conditions as stated.
Defendant states that the cash bond is too high as he does not have a significant past history of dealing with the law.
Defendant states he is somewhat self-employed with his father's business Floors-n-More.
Defendant questions what the initial appearance will entail; Court explains what the initial appearance is.
Defendant is encouraged to call the public defender's office or go there once the cash bond is posted.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  August 4, 2014 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1.
